block_comment: This block of code is a state machine handling memory interface initialization and calibration. Initially, it enables User Command (MCB_UICMDEN) and negates the completing flag (MCB_UIDONECAL). It also resets termination values (P_Term and N_Term) and sets system reset flag (Pre_SYSRST). If input termination calibration is skipped (SKIP_IN_TERM_CAL), it transitions to the "WAIT_FOR_START_BROADCAST" state while keeping termination values at null. If the input/output (IO) datapath ready signal (IODRPCTRLR_RDY_BUSY_N) is high, it transits to the "LOAD_RZQ_NTERM" state, otherwise it keeps itself in the "START" state.
